questions.question: Which of the following is a subfield of Artificial Intelligence (AI)?
What is the key difference between supervised and unsupervised learning models?
options: Supervised models use unlabeled data, unsupervised models use labeled data
Supervised models are faster, unsupervised models are slower
Supervised models use labeled data, unsupervised models use unlabeled data
questions.answer: Supervised models use labeled data, unsupervised models use unlabeled data

questions.question: What type of AI model learns from the relationship between labels of data points and classifies those data points?
Which of the following is NOT an example of a generative AI model type?
What is the main difference between Large Language Models (LLMs) and Generative AI?
options: LLMs are always generative, Generative AI is never an LLM
LLMs are generally pre-trained with a large dataset and then fine-tuned, while Generative AI is not necessarily pre-trained
LLMs generate images, Generative AI generates text
questions.answer: LLMs are generally pre-trained with a large dataset and then fine-tuned, while Generative AI is not necessarily pre-trained
